page.title: 12Transport, Swainby & Potto
page.content: United{Bus}services to Northallerton, Stokesley and Middlesbrough intersect at Swainby and travel through Potto, approximately 2-hourly. One can leave at 7.57am but the latest return is at 7.06pm. A company owning 8 buses at Ingleby Arncliffe takes Potto children to Swainby School and seniors to Stokesley, and runs popular day tours, mystery trips and 5-day holidays throughout the summer at reasonable prices.{Private transport}includes a rota of volunteers taking housebound people to a Day Centre at Hutton Rudby and Meals on Wheels twice weekly. A minibus from Community Care takes shoppers to Stokesley on alternate Thursdays. A bulk{tanker}collects milk from the dairy farms. There is a local {cattle transporter,}and most farmers have some vehicle for this purpose such as horse box, Land Rover etc.
